title: Is 10 bans really too much to ask for with 130 champions.
body: Each role has at least 20 champs that are viable in it. It would be impossible to ban out an entire ROLE and might even add more diverse gameplay.

So apparently not everyone thinks of this- so I'm just gonna leave this here.


Current champion requirements for Ranked: 
16 champions owned
That's 5 champions on your team, plus the 3 bans.
Times 2, so 16.
Currently the IP cost of that would be, at minimum.
12 x 450 = 5400
4 x 1350 = 5400
For a total of 10800 IP.
That's bare bones too, you wouldn't have a single Assassins at all if I remember right. And it assumes you didn't buy a single rune.

Now let's say they increase this amount:
Still 5 champions on your team, but now with 5 bans instead of 3.
Times 2, that's 20 champions.
12 x 450 = 5400
8 x 1350 = 10800
For a total of 16200 IP. That's 50% more of a requirement just because you want more bans. And it assumes you bought no runes at all and never bought a single champion that wasn't the cheapest possible.

The game is **already** known to be very hard to get into- how is making Ranked even more difficult to join going to help this problem that already is acknowledged to exist? 

And why should you be given more bans anyways? There are not 10 OP champions at any given time. Bans are for the extreme cases that are just blatantly too strong- not champions you *think* are too strong or don't want to deal with.
Edit: And actually I'm pretty sure you *can* ban out an entire role with 10 bans, or at least all the viable champions of the role.

This is mostly wrong.

 The "get into" argument is for the game in general, not ranked. Ranked is FAR TOO EASY to get into right now, and SHOULD be tightened up in several areas. You can spend barely 10k IP in champs and jump into ranked, and then lose every game because you're an idiot who doesn't know the first thing about how the game operates. That's an argument for locking it down, not preventing needed game functions like more bans.

 Secondly, bans are exactly intended to ban out problem champs for your strategy- that's code for "shit you don't want to deal with". But when you have as many broken nonsense champs as this game does, it becomes "work out what the ban meta is and follow it unless you try to get one of them yourself". Since the balance team has proven beyond a shadow of a doubt that their one priority is keeping LCS big plays champs in vogue and that they couldn't care less about the state of the game for the rest of us this problem is not going to go away anytime soon. Ten bans should be seen as a minimum.

 edit: Also, the "ban out an entire role" argument is complete nonsense. For this to happen, you would need 10 players to have the same idea at the same time (remember, teams cannot communicate) and the second player decides to go for it after a single ban. This simply isn't going to happen in the real world, and even if the stars align and it does ONCE, who the hell cares? Both teams are now at the same disadvantage.

The main arguments against it seem to be:

* But you can ban an entire role!

No, you can't. Even if all five members of both teams decided to all ban a certain role (something that would probably not happen often if at all) ten bans could not ban out an entire role.

* But now you need more champs to get into ranked!

We've all seen the people that hit level 30 and leap right into ranked and feed because they weren't ready. And if you're smurfing, part of the price for smurfing is leveling your account to 30 and buying all the champs and runes needed to play ranked. This is a problem that should be solved with better IP gains, not less bans.

* But pros can have their champs banned out!

If a pro is defeated by five bans, then he's not much of a pro. I don't think it's unreasonable to ask a pro to be proficient with more than a handful of champs at any given time. If you ban out all of one player's mains, you have left the other four players on the team their mains. And it's not like pro matches can't just keep the six bans if pros complain too much anyway.

You want status quo to be changed. You have to tell me why. I don't have to tell you why not.

- But so many OP champs!

Assuming people do actually ban the "OP champs": OP tier -> deleted. Tier 1 -> OP tier. Tier 2 -> Tier 1 and so on.
No gains.

Assuming people do not ban the "OP champs": It's worthless then anyways.

- But there are way more champions back when 6 bans was decided!

Your point? 

- But it looks better on the new champ select!

So what.

- "More diverse gameplay" (OP) 

How? The amount of champions available decreases. Balance rotations are going to do the metashifting anyways, no need for more bans.

Bans are meant to get rid of your counters or just champions you don't want to deal with. Right now, OP champions are a thing so bans are used to get rid of those. Maybe as a top main, you don't want to deal with Fiora, regardless of whether she's OP at the time or not. That ban isn't worthless, since that increases your chance of success too.
And more bans would increase diversity instead of the top 16 pick/ban champs, we'll have top 20 pick/ban champs. The concept of "power pick" wouldn't exist--at least not as much as it is now.

The reasoning for only 6 bans is competitive play where they could ban a players entire champ pool with 4-5 bans.

But solo que bans should be treated differently.
